level.text: PERS is a system located in a recipient’s home that summons assistance from a friend, relative, or an emergency services provider (police, fire department, or ambulance) and is available twenty-four (24) hours a day, seven (7) days a week.
Each PERS system shall be comprised of three (3) basic elements:
A small radio transmitter (portable help button) carried by the user;
A console or receiving base connected to a user’s telephone; and
A response center or responder to monitor the calls.
The PERS is composed of two (2) procedures:
Installation of the service unit; and
The unit of service shall be one (1) unit per monthly rental.
Approved as part of the recipient’s ISP; and

Completed by personnel who are employed by the PERS service provider and approved by the recipient’s case manager. A copy of the approved ISP shall be incorporated into the recipient’s service record. The record shall be maintained for a period of not less than six (6) years.
